results.byline: By Maria Abi-Habib and Rami Nazzal
results.title: Settler Violence Against Palestinians in the West Bank Is Rising
results.abstract: More than 100 Palestinians have been killed, more than 2,000 injured and nearly 1,000 forcibly displaced by Israeli settlers since Hamas’s Oct. 7 attacks on Israel, the United Nations said.

media.caption: Damaged properties last week at the West Bank village of Wadi al-Siq. Representatives of a community of 200 Bedouin herders living there said that Jewish settlers, accompanied by police officers and Israeli soldiers, had attacked the village on Oct. 12.

results.title: Panel Says That Innovative Sickle Cell Cure Is Safe Enough for Patients
results.abstract: The decision by an advisory committee may lead to Food and Drug Administration approval of the first treatment for humans that uses the CRISPR gene-editing system.

results.title: F.B.I. Says Israel-Hamas War Raises Potential for Attack Against Americans
results.abstract: Since the attacks by Hamas, antisemitic threats in the U.S. have reached “historic levels,” the agency’s director said. Threats against Muslims have also increased.

results.byline: By Michael C. Bender and Michael Gold
results.title: How Trump’s Verbal Slips Could Weaken His Attacks on Biden’s Age
results.abstract: Donald Trump, 77, has relentlessly attacked President Biden, 80, as too old for office. But the former president himself has had a series of gaffes that go beyond his usual freewheeling style.

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump’s Republican presidential rivals have seized on several recent stumbles in his public speeches.

results.title: Autoworkers Score Big Wins in New Contracts With Carmakers
results.abstract: Tentative accords at Ford Motor, General Motors and Stellantis are the most generous in decades, raising costs as the industry shifts to electric vehicles.

media.caption: The United Automobile Workers union escalated its strike against General Motors as recently as Saturday. Earlier it struck the company’s largest plant, in Arlington, Texas.

results.title: A Leaning Tower in Italy (Not Pisa) Becomes a Worry
results.abstract: City officials in Bologna have closed a city-center square as they study what to do about the Garisenda Tower. A solution could take years.

media.caption: Recent surveys of the Garisenda Tower, left of the much taller Asinelli Tower in Bologna, Italy, have found traces of unexpected rotation in its incline.
media.copyright: Susan Wright for The New York Times

results.title: Johnson’s Israel Aid Bill Sets Stage for a Clash Over Security Assistance
results.abstract: By splitting money for Israel’s war effort from aid to Ukraine and coupling it with spending cuts, Speaker Mike Johnson has put the House on a collision course with the Senate and President Biden.

media.caption: Speaker Mike Johnson appears to have structured the Israel legislation in an effort to keep his conference united in the early days of his speakership.

results.title: Man Indicted Over Threats to D.A. and Sheriff in Trump’s Georgia Case
results.abstract: “Be looking over your shoulder,” the man said in a voice mail message for Fani Willis, the Fulton County prosecutor who filed charges against former President Donald Trump.
des_facet: Georgia Criminal Case Against Trump (2020 Election)

media.caption: Fani Willis, the Fulton County district attorney, has said that she received more than 150 threats in about two months after she filed criminal charges against former President Donald Trump and others seeking to overturn 2020 election results in Georgia.
